title: Workshop on Reflective Practice Strategies for Digital Learning Environment Design

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in operating secondary education curricula and basic digital tool proficiency
context.additional_context: A course for in-service secondary educators to improve instructional design tailored to learner needs in digital environments

learning_goals: Learners can propose three or more context-specific strategies reflecting learner needs analysis when designing digital learning environments
Learners can diagnose and adjust problems occurring in the instructional design process in real-time using reflective practice (Reflection-in-Action) techniques
Learners can derive creative solutions to overcome constraints of digital learning environments by applying conjecturing strategies
Learners can visualize and structure complex learning design processes using external representation tools to collaborate with peers
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
